alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 9:54AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Continuing and Travel is Slowly Deteriorating... .Most of the area saw morning snows with the heaviest band from northeast Iowa into central Wisconsin. There, 5 to 8 inches has been reported as of 9 am. Roads were snow covered for the most part although most interstates across the area are showing some pavement per D O T road cameras. As the afternoon progresses, snow will diminish across far northcentral Wisconsin into southeast Minnesota. However, areas near, south, and east of La Crosse Wisconsin will continue to have accumulating snow. The heaviest snow will fall across southwest Wisconsin and far northeast Iowa where 3 to 4 additional inches is expected this afternoon. Snow will then diminish from west to east there in the evening. Highest overall storm total accumulations of 9 to 12 inches are expected from northeast Iowa into southwest and central Wisconsin. Northwest winds will increase as well with gusts 30 to 40 mph at times this afternoon through tonight. As a result, blowing and drifting snow may rapidly reduce visibilities and driving conditions especially along unsheltered areas and ridgetops. Downed trees and power outages are also possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 or 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
